item.title: Tess add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Tess add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "L'attesa lunga, il mio sogno di te non finito." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Tess add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "The wait is long, my dream of you does not end." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Tess add a quote by Regina McBride
item.description: "Buadhann an thoighde ar an gcinneamhain." -- Regina McBride

item.title: Tess add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tess add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Tess add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "All which is beautiful and noble is the result of reason and calculation." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "The safest course was actually the simplest-do nothing at all and hope everything turned out for the best. It wasn't a great plan, but it had the benefits of simplicity and a long tradition. " -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "I didn't set out to discover a truth. I was actually sent to the Outer Fringes to conduct a chair census and learn some humility. But the truth inevitably found me, as important truths often do, like a lost thought in need of a mind." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "Like all failed experiments, that one taught me something I didn’t expect: one key ingredient of so-called experience is the delusional faith that it is unique and special, that those included in it are privileged and those excluded from it are missing out." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Tess add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tess add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Tess add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Tess add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Tess add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I no longer drink nearly as much as I used to but, still, my motto is Sine coffea nihil sum. Without coffee, I'm nothing." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Tess add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I have a similar affection for the parenthesis (but I always take most of my parentheses out, so as not to call undue attention to the glaring fact that I cannot think in complete sentences, that I think only in short fragments or long, run-on thought relays that the literati call stream of consciousness but I still like to think of as disdain for the finality of the period)." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Tess add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "The only thing more dangerous than an idea is a belief." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "That which yields is not always weak." -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "All paths are present, always... and we can but choose among them." -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Tess add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "Why is there ever this perverse cruelty in humankind, that makes us hurt most those we love best?" -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Tess add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Tess add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "My personal hobbies are reading, listening to music, and silence." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Tess add a quote by Beth Hoffman (Author)
item.description: "It's what we believe about ourselves that determines how others see us." -- Beth Hoffman (Author)

item.title: Tess add a quote by Beth Hoffman
item.description: "It's how we survive the hurts in life that brings us strength and gives us our beauty." -- Beth Hoffman

item.title: Tess add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Tess add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description:
"I was ripe ten years ago. Now I’m merely preserved, and before long I’ll be buried back in the orchard with the other pits.”
-Amanda to Jack" -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Tess add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description: "Set the world afire. Just let me hand you the matches." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Tess add a quote by Lisa Kleypas
item.description:
"He took his mouth from hers and stared down at her with eyes so dark they no longer looked blue. “Amanda, do you trust me?”
“Of course not,” she said. “I don’t know the first thing about you.”
Laughter rustled from his chest. “Sensible woman." -- Lisa Kleypas

item.title: Tess add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Tess add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "There are words to describe her, my dear, but one does not repeat them in polite company." -- Gail Carriger
